questions.question: This simple cipher shifts each character by a given value
This was the effective keysize of the DES cipher
This country was the first to break the Enigma machine
The AES standards defines this many possible block sizes
This cipher was used incorrectly in WEP
This is the core maintainer of the Linux operating system
Rumours that he could launch nuclear missiles by whistling into the phone caused this man to be left in solitary confinement for 8 months
John "Captain Crunch" Draper discovered that toy whistles from the Captain Crunch box blew this very important frequency
This man wrote - and shares his name with - the first (known) computer worm in history
This man helped the FBI capture Kevin Mitnick
He's the all-too-friendly next door neighbour
This is the name of the Simpsons family's dog
In the famous two-part episode, this person was the one who shot Mr Burns
These are the names of the three main bullies (not counting Nelson)
questions.answer: Jimbo, Kearney, and Dolph (or "James Jones", "Kevin Zzyzwicz", and "Darren Starbeam")

questions.question: This toy, released by Kid First Industries, was programmed to attack other toys
This movie popularized the phrase "hack the Gibson".
This movie featured breaking into a government agency during fellatio.
This movie contained the famous line "the only winning move is not to play".
This movie's was based on a novel titled "Men Who Hate Women".
This movie featured the memorable phrase "My voice is my passport".
This exploit occurs when more data is written than memory is allocated.
This exploit involves finding gadgets to bypass a non-executable stack.
This exploit permits an attacker to add data to the end of a hash without knowing all data that produced it.
This attack involves deriving information from timing or power consumption information.
This attack involves logging into a service with a hashed password instead of the password itself.
